bottom.translation[0].definitions[0].def: the flat surface on the lowest side of an object
bottom.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: What’s that on the bottom of your shoe?
bottom.translation[0].definitions[1].def: the lowest inner surface of something such as a container
bottom.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The drugs had been hidden in a suitcase with a false bottom.
I found the keys – they were at the bottom of my handbag.
bottom.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: I just sat on my bottom and slid down.
bottom.translation[0].definitions[3].def: the part of a set of clothes that you wear on the lower part of your body
bottom.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: the bottom
the lowest part of something
The house is at the bottom of that hill.
She scrolled down to the bottom of the screen.
the underneath/the underside
the bottom surface on the outside of something
You will find the serial number on the underneath of the vacuum cleaner.
base
the lowest part or the wide bottom part on which something stands
The lamp has a square base.
He had broken a bone at the base of his spine.
the foot
the bottom of a tree, a hill, or some stairs
There was a small village at the foot of the mountain.
bed
the ground at the bottom of a river, a lake, or the sea
the sea bed
They found some interesting stones on the river bed.
the foundations
the layer of cement and stones that forms the bottom of a building
The builders have begun laying the foundations for the house.
bottom.translation[1].definitions[0].def: in the lowest place or position
bottom.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The towels are in the bottom drawer.
You’ve got some butter on your bottom lip.
the bottom right-hand corner of the page
bottom.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: I was bottom of the class (=the least successful student) in Spanish.
Britain came bottom on efforts to tackle pollution and global warming.
bottom.translation[1].definitions[2].def: in the place furthest away from where you are
bottom.translation[1].note_box[0].sectio: My passport’s in the bottom drawer of my desk.
Jenna sat on the bottom step.
Look at the bottom left-hand corner of your screen.
That’s me in the middle of the bottom row of the photograph.
There’s were only two windows in the bottom half of the building.
I put my foot on the bottom rung and started to climb.
Her bottom lip trembled and she started to cry.
bottom.translation[3].definitions[0].def: a humorous character who is changed into a donkey in Shakespeare’s play A midsummer night’s dream
bottom.translation[4].definitions[0].def: the lowest point, position, or level
bottom.translation[4].definitions[0].exa: Hopefully, we are finally seeing the bottom of this recession.
Short-term interest rates are now probably near their bottom.
bottom.translation[4].definitions[1].def: to get to the lowest possible point, position, or level in price or performance
bottom.translation[4].definitions[1].exa: He believes gold prices have hit bottom or are close to it.
Thailand’s economic slowdown may have reached bottom and signs are some sectors are recovering.
bottom.translation[4].definitions[2].def: used to say that prices reach extremely low levels, with many businesses and people in financial difficulty
bottom.translation[4].definitions[2].exa: The recession came and the bottom dropped out of the market for luxury houses.
The bottom fell out of the wool market and many farmers went bust.
